Scrapper_Helpers.convert_to_alnum(s: str, replace_char: str = '_') → str[source]¶

Remove from string s all non-alpha-numerical symbols.

Parameters

  • s (str) – source strinr

  • replace_char – char instead non-alpha-numerical symbol

Returns

(str) new string

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.convert_to_alnum( '#: {{syn|en|felid}}' )
'_____syn_en_felid__'
Scrapper_Helpers.create_storage(folder_name)[source]¶

Create folders recusively.

In:

folder_name: Storage folder name

Scrapper_Helpers.deduplicate(s: str, char: str = '_') → str[source]¶

Replace duplicated chars from string.

Parameters

  • s (str) – source string

  • char (str) – duplicated char which need deduplicate

Returns

(str) deduplicated string

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.deduplicate( "abc__def" )
'abc_def'

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.deduplicate( "abc_def" )
'abc_def'

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.deduplicate( "abc_____def")
'abc_def'

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.deduplicate( "abc     def", ' ')
'abc def'
Scrapper_Helpers.dict_merge(dct: dict, merge_dct: dict)[source]¶

Recursive dict merge. Inspired by :meth:dict.update(), instead of updating only top-level keys, dict_merge recurses down into dicts nested to an arbitrary depth, updating keys. The merge_dct is merged into dct. :param dct: dict onto which the merge is executed :param merge_dct: dct merged into dct :return: None

Scrapper_Helpers.extract_from_link(s: str, startpos: int = 0) → str[source]¶

Extract string from [[…]]] square brackets.

Parameters

  • s (str) – source string

  • startpos (int) – start position

Returns

(str) New string with clean text.

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.extract_from_link( '# An animal of the family [[Felidae]]:' )
'# An animal of the family Felidae:'
Scrapper_Helpers.filterWodsProblems(s: str, context=None) → str[source]¶

Filter word. If not correct retirn None

Scrapper_Helpers.first_true(iterable, default=False, pred=None)[source]¶

Returns the first true value in the iterable.

If no true value is found, returns default

If pred is not None, returns the first item for which pred(item) is true.

name of caller

Scrapper_Helpers.get_contents(filename: str) → str[source]¶

Read the file ‘filename’ and return content.

>>> with open('checkpoint.txt' , 'w') as f:
>>>    f.write( 'test data')

>>> import Scrapper_Helpers
>>> Scrapper_Helpers.get_contents( 'checkpoint.txt' )
'test data'
Scrapper_Helpers.get_lognest_word(lst: list) → str[source]¶

Return word with maximal length.

Parameters

lst (lsit) – list with words

Returns

(str) word

a = ['', 'syn', 'en', 'felid', '']
>>> Scrapper_Helpers.get_lognest_word( a )
'felid'
Scrapper_Helpers.get_number(s: str) → str[source]¶

Return numrical part from string.

Parameters

s (str) – source string

Returns

(str) heading string with numbers only

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.get_number( '1a' )
'1'

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.get_number( '10a' )
'10'
Scrapper_Helpers.is_ascii(s: str) → bool[source]¶

Primitive fast version of ASCII checker.

Test all symbols for ASCII or not.

Parameters

s (str) – source string

Returns

(bool)

  • True - all is ACSII

  • False- not all is ACSII

Scrapper_Helpers.iterable_to_stream(iterable, buffer_size=8192)[source]¶

Lets you use an iterable (e.g. a generator) that yields bytestrings as a read-only input stream.

The stream implements Python 3’s newer I/O API (available in Python 2’s io module). For efficiency, the stream is buffered.

Load Treemap from the file ‘filename’. File must be in Pickle format.

In:

filename

Out:

sorteddict

Scrapper_Helpers.proper(s: str) → str[source]¶

Make string Proper case. First char is upper-case, rest - lower.

Parameters

s (str) – source string

Returns

(str) Proper-cased string

>>> import Scrapper_Helpers
>>> Scrapper_Helpers.proper( 'jazz' )
'Jazz'
Scrapper_Helpers.put_contents(filename, content)[source]¶

Save ‘content’ to the file ‘filename’. UTF-8.

>>> import Scrapper_Helpers
>>> Scrapper_Helpers.put_contents( 'checkpoint.txt' , '12345')

>>> with open('checkpoint.txt' , 'r') as f:
>>>    f.read()
'12345'
Scrapper_Helpers.remove_comments(s: str, startpos: int = 0) → str[source]¶

Remove HTML comments from string.

Parameters

  • s (str) – source string

  • startpos (int) – start position

Returns

(str) New string without comments

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.remove_comments( '<!-- The comment -->Clean text' )
'Clean text'
Scrapper_Helpers.retry(ExceptionToCheck, tries=4, delay=3, backoff=2, logger=None)[source]¶

Retry calling the decorated function using an exponential backoff. http://www.saltycrane.com/blog/2009/11/trying-out-retry-decorator-python/ original from: http://wiki.python.org/moin/PythonDecoratorLibrary#Retry :param ExceptionToCheck: the exception to check. may be a tuple of

exceptions to check

Parameters

  • tries (int) – number of times to try (not retry) before giving up

  • delay (int) – initial delay between retries in seconds

  • backoff (int) – backoff multiplier e.g. value of 2 will double the delay each retry

  • logger (logging.Logger instance) – logger to use. If None, print

Scrapper_Helpers.sanitize_filename(filename)[source]¶

Remove from string ‘filename’ all nonascii chars and punctuations.

Scrapper_Helpers.save()[source]¶
Scrapper_Helpers.save_to_json(obj, filename)[source]¶

Sve object obj to file in JSON format.

With pretty format with indent 4 spaces.

Args:

obj: object filename: file name

>>> Scrapper_Helpers.save_to_json( [1,2,3], '123.json' )
>>> with open('123.json' , 'r') as f:
...  f.read()
...
'[

1, 2, 3

]’

In:

treemap filename

Scrapper_Helpers.unique(lst: list) → list[source]¶

Unique list items.

Source list keeps unchanged.

Parameters

lst (list) – List with items

Returns

(list)

>>> import Scrapper_Helpers
>>> Scrapper_Helpers.unique([1,1,1,2,3])
[1, 2, 3]
